102822B61A5A4960BB3EA2B7BB9D732E.description: Critique the statement “Any function that can be written in the form y = a(x - p)² + q will have a parabolic graph.

AA3D3E172AC1428BB63B60CF8B82C5A6.description: Solve situational questions involving the characteristics and graphs of quadratic functions.

1E5E9CF1398A4B1CB9A404833DA79C4A.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for sketching the graph of a quadratic function.

21DE060252AD4CB5928805858E32E792.description: Explain what the domain and range of a quadratic function tell about the situation that the quadratic function models.

949C145D62B84A968DAF9791BBE5DD6F.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the domain and range of a quadratic function.

DF87A5875F7A4A0DB7C6705603CF9D3F.description: Generalize about and explain the effects on the graph of a quadratic function when the values for a, p, and q are changed.

D9E015517BC54B86B5E4430EA3B8735D.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the coordinates of the vertex of the graph of a quadratic function and for determining if the vertex is a maximum or a minimum.

9AF8AB31A10043DDBE46F9FD036DF280.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply a strategy for determining the equation of the axis of symmetry of the graph of a quadratic function when given the x-intercepts of the graph.

6C56E9CA159B435F9F5B86D8BCC56626.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies (with or without the use of technology) to determine the coordinates of the vertex of the graph of a quadratic function.

A7566C3DC8A942589DA5E64A5B1532C0.description: Write a quadratic equation in factored form given the zeros of a corresponding quadratic function or the x-intercepts of a corresponding quadratic function.

3730A736ABCF4F15862C8DC0AF63EA11.description: Explain, using examples, why the graph of a quadratic function may have zero, one, or two x-intercepts

E77BCB4AD4B44BCB88112910407756A5.description: Conjecture and verify a relationship among the roots of an equation, the zeros of the corresponding function, and the x-intercepts of the graph of the function.

A766DF23562B494DAAED7681DD44DE70.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the intercepts of the graph of a quadratic function, including factoring, graphing (with or without the use of technology), and use of the quadratic formula.

2E83982639414559902A4B7BDEC41D8E.description: Identify situations and objects relevant to self, family, or community which could be described using a quadratic function.

C88543EE5B12472288C152518CA96A7A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics of quadratic functions of the form y = a(x - p)² + q , including:: vertex, intercepts, domain and range and axis of symmetry.

01F43E21168145818747339859208B52.description: Apply knowledge of graphing of systems of linear inequalities and linear programming to solve optimization questions.

B75E3D32F0924287ACBE242BEDBFD946.description: Match optimization questions and the graphs of sets of linear inequalities.

1A54199802CE47EF81B701F00FBD29EB.description: Write a system of linear inequalities for a given graph.

86397664B35F4A458858C1CFD21C7062.description: Explain, using examples, the meaning of the shaded region in the graphical solution of a system of linear inequalities.

5BFC0623F1224C1A88BA7EC7EEEA3664.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for verifying solutions to systems of linear inequalities, including the use of test points.

BFF6BD0802694C5F8B0A14BB5A4B5A59.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for graphing and solving systems of linear inequalities, including justification of the choice of solid or broken lines.

1CFA8C04B1D54EF59BC249B1FD946587.description: Identify situations relevant to self, family, or community which could be described using a system of linear inequalities in two variables.

452F5E3765E34252898C2CA02F989747.description: Demonstrate understanding of systems of linear inequalities in two variables

3BC7A7A3F1B74C9C9ECD3CFFA14C74A1.description: Support a position or decision relevant to self, family, or community by analyzing statistical data, as well as considering other factors.

838C838C3EB94CD0917FF96A7F33E1A8.description: Provide and critique examples from print or electronic media in which confidence intervals and confidence levels are used to support a particular position.

1043CAFE4CB34E419ADF6344255F01E2.description: Make inferences and decisions with justification about a population from sample data using confidence intervals.

AFC99EC7368F4822B8901C1FC7039270.description: Explain how confidence levels, margins of error, and confidence intervals can be impacted by the size of the random sample used.

BEBC89A3846847B59EBB9894CAB8F6CF.description: Identify and explain the significance of the confidence interval, margin of error, or confidence level stated with respect to statistical data relevant to self, family, or community.

732E449AF92B4D82B42C95FFE72B2ED1.description: Demonstrate understanding of the interpretation of statistical data, including: confidence intervals, confidence levels and margin of error.

5807671182604FBF9E0FC58A49036C3F.description: Pose and solve situational questions relevant to self, family, or community that involve normal distributions and z-scores.

5D033E9C1EA941BAB22DFDAF1578275E.description: Determine, with or without technology, and explain the meaning of the z-score for a given value in a normally distributed data set.

CE40781E1BDE4D60BD8D22EAF2E3B285.description: Solve situational questions that involve the interpretation of standard deviations to make decisions.

4E3DE4188E814564897DC69709E7F23F.description: Explain, using examples that represent multiple perspectives, the application of standard deviation for making decisions in situations such as warranties, insurance, or opinion polls.

D98B03F674C548D99515B3D67FC01E88.description: Compare the properties of two or more normally distributed data sets and explain what the comparison tells you about the situations that the sets represent.

969394F2F32643A5BF525D71730FAE37.description: Analyze a data set to determine if it approximates a normal distribution.

80ECEC0445F4471190730DDFF672EB8A.description: Critique the statement “Every set of data will correspond to a normal distribution”

9210AC1356574806B8F0B701B67F6A9A.description: Calculate, using technology, the population standard deviation of a data set.

304ABCC5F6694DD9BF16C991E98DF0E7.description: Explain the meaning and purpose of the properties of a normal curve, including mean, median, mode, standard deviation, symmetry, and area under the curve.

46D8FCFBFC214D5195924934AC821320.description: Identify situations relevant to self, family, or community in which standard deviation and the normal distribution are used and explain the meaning and relevance of each.

A1ACDF021EC9445DA143FC04C5EDB098.description: Demonstrate an understanding of normal distribution, including standard deviation and z-scores.

D2DAB08CC8A74D8AA9956210BBDC50A9.description: Solve situational questions involving triangles without a right angle.

B33784A3945346C48E6327B0D7D25072.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the number of solutions possible to a situation involving the ambiguous case.

25FDC64847DC4F109CDD7C9972D93E9D.description: Illustrate and explain how one, two, or no triangles could be possible for a given set of measurements for two side lengths and the non-included angle in a proposed triangle.

5F94525036764EF2948B66CF67327500.description: Explain the steps in a given proof of the sine law or cosine law

F924952DB7FC4172A0BA430F3C90E2A3.description: Draw diagrams to represent situations in which the cosine law or sine law could be used to solve a question.

0C282C27E4FA4E67B3D813D8912F2685.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining angles or side lengths of triangles without a right angle.

7132271FDB3242B799B330FBB423F896.description: Identify and describe situations relevant to self, family, or community that involve triangles without a right angle.

FF56A39DBB64417EBCC7CFDBACFE4936.description: Demonstrate understanding of the cosine law and sine law (including the ambiguous case).

168F7164E42E405198F3C838DC495B05.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for constructing parallel lines.

1C1F0C8D25884E9D974DDC65D1325B0F.description: Solve situational problems that involve: angles, parallel lines, and transversals, angles, non-parallel lines, and transversals, angles in triangles and angles in polygons.

5CF66365AB5D4C789AC6FFACD157A1FF.description: Explore and verify whether or not the angles formed by nonparallel lines and transversals create the same angle relationships as those created by parallel lines and transversals.

A9BA3F84E24849E699CFBCDBD26EA8C2.description: Apply knowledge of angles formed by parallel lines and transversals to identify and correct errors in a given proof.

DCE44C2BCB86475AA0DD4A7BDD898E10.description: Generalize, using inductive reasoning, a rule for the relationship between the sum of the interior angles and the number of sides (n) in a polygon, with or without technology.

6AF87822F7874BE38F9A426A6CD71375.description: Prove and apply the relationship relating the sum of the angles in a triangle.

58421F389B544019BB5B0A17F2D37109.description: Develop, generalize, explain, apply, and prove relationships between pairs of angles formed by transversals and parallel lines, with and without the use of technology.

6A6A3A077ED5485685CBA67458636B52.description: Identify and describe situations relevant to self, family, or community that involve parallel lines cut by transversals.

3EF91518EE414EC3BD2B0BF6773B389B.description: Demonstrate understanding of properties of angles and triangles including: deriving proofs based on theorems and postulates about congruent triangles and solving problems.

8E7A5B0700E14AA2A1F328A1CF8D88FE.description: Solve situational questions that involve scale factors, areas, surface areas, and volumes, including ones that require the manipulation of formulas.

2E29DB4866BF4EFA8CA4B2A401C87667.description: Explain, with justification, the effect of a change in scale factor on the area of a 2-D shape or the surface area or volume of a 3-D object.

20DEE45DBCF34353B6F689DAEF871395.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining scale factors, areas, surface areas, or volumes given the scale factor or the ratio of areas, surface areas, or volumes of 2-D shapes and 3-D objects.

5D745D43F74142ABB2FD9BDF9375F490.description: Determine relationships between scale factor and area of 2-D shapes or surface area of 3-D objects; and scale factor, surface area, and volume of 3-D objects.

F91978361E2C48248A7D27010BA60430.description: Solve situational problems involving scale diagrams of 2-D shapes and 3-D objects.

F57BAD2AE14F4A4EAF37AC10AC05C2AD.description: Draw, with or without the use of technology, a scale diagram of a 2-D shape relevant to self, family, or community to a specified scale factor (enlargement or reduction).

E4D61C7753454B9F8BB80374F20CD555.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for solving situational questions based upon scale diagrams of 2-D shapes and 3-D objects, including the determining of scale factors and unknown dimensions.

819603039DC04451A3FBDF722B5F28DA.description: Identify and describe situations relevant to one’s self, family, or community that involve scale diagrams of 2-D shapes and 3-D objects and determine the scale factor for the situations.

B138A1D9B11846F097F03AECF0814E01.description: Solve situational questions involving rates, including unit rates.

30C1865F84264086958DEEA4DD66EDA3.description: Identify and explain the effect of factors within given situations that could influence a particular rate.

A6495F5A406243C78514466D44361DEF.description: Explain, using examples, the relationship between the slope of a graph and a rate.

BBA49E2E5210433BACCCDC74EE60B72A.description: Analyze situations in which unit rates can be determined and suggest reasons why the rates would or would not be used to make decisions in each situation (i.e., are other factors in the situation outweighing the importance of the mathematical calculations?).

D1296196CAF64FCEBE1772A3A02E123F.description: Solve situational questions that require the use of proportional reasoning, including those that involve the isolation of a variable.

F4764DF6E31949BA93336E6639F43115.description: Explain the meaning of rates given in context, such as the arts, commerce, the environment, medicine, or recreation.

6DD35BBB979B4C31AFA48477B11C9912.description: Describe situations in which a given rate might occur.

135FD6A551A54DDFA7913B71B8CE144E.description: Create non-symbolic representations for rates, including pictures and graphs.

DA965B9B341440E4A2FB847E05F7B00F.description: Identify and describe situations relevant to one’s self, family, or community that involve proportional reasoning.

C656C1FCD6884FFDA598D0FAFD22FFCC.description: Expand and demonstrate understanding of proportional reasoning related to: rates, scale diagrams, scale factor, area, surface area and volume.

B7835F94395545978A580CBBD3F5CFFE.description: Create a variation of a puzzle or a game, and describe a strategy for solving the puzzle or winning the game.

C7068E101F7A4388B144F17BE90FE35C.description: Determine, explain, and verify strategies for solving puzzles or winning games, such as: guess and check, analyze a pattern, make a systematic list, create a drawing or model, eliminate possibilities, solve simpler problems and work backward.

7E7B46145D7F40F4BA296204CBC79105.description: Solve situational questions that involve inductive or deductive reasoning.

3B3AA424A0FD483E9B4842C90B09E15A.description: Identify errors in proofs that lead to incorrect conclusions (e.g., a proof that ends with 2 = 1).

9584658747334C89B91EDFDA46CDA0DA.description: Analyze an argument for its validity

8D000990F4F64C5780FC4806193D4E79.description: Prove algebraic number relationships, such as divisibility rules, number properties, mental mathematics strategies, or algebraic number tricks using deductive reasoning.

842DA41B50F346868820284122429C12.description: Identify situations relevant to self, family, or community involving inductive and/or deductive reasoning.

73F136A314494C3DB5F2DB2EAAC3ABBD.description: Critique the following statement “Decisions can be made and actions taken based upon inductive reasoning”.

77D4882743C641DEAAD2FFC13487A8DE.description: Provide examples of how inductive reasoning might lead to false conclusions.

273F1C091B144055997A315B296D9C57.description: Make conjectures by observing patterns and identifying properties, and justify the reasoning.

6C39751CBA434FFAA3D54A510B932D0E.description: Demonstrate understanding of inductive and deductive reasoning including: analyzing conjectures, analyzing spatial puzzles and games, providing conjectures and solving problems.

AD9DEA315A264217ADDCC3697020EB7D.description: Organize and create a presentation (oral, written, multimedia, etc.) of the research findings and conclusions.

520B77D45ACE49A0A92189561CA072CB.description: Identify controversial issues, if any, and present multiple sides of the issues with supporting data.

924C2162CCB9432FACDF8ACBF6599270.description: Interpret data, using statistical methods if applicable.

391135F075104B8094A36126E7E8FAED.description: Assess the accuracy, reliability, and relevance of the primary or secondary data (quantitative/qualitative) collected by: identifying examples of bias and points of view, identifying and describing the data collection methods, determining whether or not the data are relevant and  determining whether or not the data are consistent with information obtained from other sources on the same topic.

0337C37CD4484EA4B41BF5A28AA0D56C.description: Collect primary or secondary data (quantitative or qualitative) related to the topic.

C1B986F716634A6A853BF348C32D6F4E.description: Develop a rubric or other scoring schema for the assessment of the research and presentation.

7B2F31A807BD417AB6CD8104C73F671E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the mathematics involved in an historical event or an area of interest.
